unnormalised: **Automotive Buzz: Mumbai Traffic Gets a Makeover!**
normalised: **Automotive Buzz: Mumbai Traffic Gets a Makeover!**

unnormalised: Oyee Mumbai! Get ready for some traffic rule changes that might just save your sanity (or at least a few minutes). Dr. Patil from the Traffic Police HQ announced some updates to the regulations effective 15th August.
normalised: Oyee Mumbai! Get ready for some traffic rule changes that might just save your sanity (or at least a few minutes). Doctor Patil from the Traffic Police H Q announced some updates to the regulations effective fifteenth August.

unnormalised: First up, no more haphazard parking around Dadar chowk. Seriously, people! They're cracking down with hefty fines, starting from Rs. 2000. Also, watch out for the new speed limit on the Bandra-Worli Sea Link - capped at 80 kmph.
normalised: First up, no more haphazard parking around Dadar chowk. Seriously, people! They're cracking down with hefty fines, starting from rupee two thousand. Also, watch out for the new speed limit on the Bandra-Worli Sea Link - capped at eighty kilometer per hour.

unnormalised: Remember that uncle who always cuts lanes near Siddhivinayak Temple? Yeah, he's gonna get a rude awakening. The authorities are installing more CCTV cameras, covering an area of 5000 sq ft, to catch these traffic offenders.
normalised: Remember that uncle who always cuts lanes near Siddhivinayak Temple? Yeah, he's gonna get a rude awakening. The authorities are installing more C C T V cameras, covering an area of five thousand square feet, to catch these traffic offenders.

unnormalised: Plus, new regulations dictate mandatory helmet use for pillion riders across the city. So, bhabhi, please wear your helmet! Think of your safety and avoid the Rs. 1000 fine! Let's make Mumbai roads safer, shall we? Jai Maharashtra!
normalised: Plus, new regulations dictate mandatory helmet use for pillion riders across the city. So, bhabhi, please wear your helmet! Think of your safety and avoid the rupee one thousand fine! Let's make Mumbai roads safer, shall we? Jai Maharashtra!
